results.title: Roy Hollsdotter live
results.creator_credit: Matthew Saville, Trevor Blainey, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria and Retro Active Films
results.brief_description: After being ditched by his girlfriend, misanthropic stand-up comedian Roy Hollsdotter lapses into a downward spiral of self-loathing, hitting the self destruct button at every turn. Despite the appeals of best friend Simmo to get over it, Roy continues on his antagonistic journey swiping mercilessly at all who have the misfortune to cross his path. Filmed in The Esplanade’s Gershwin Room, this black comedy is a searing portrait of a man at war with himself. Stars real-life stand up comedian Darren Casey in the title role. This disc also contains amusing early shorts by Matthew Saville.

results.title: Roundabout
results.creator_credit: Leah Miller, Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Presents a story about a young boy’s experience with an old man who owns a magical toy merry-go-round and tells what happens when it is stolen by the boy’s friends. Designed to stimulate discussion about responsibility and consideration for others. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Rumpelstilzchen. Passion
results.creator_credit: Jurgen Reble, Barooni, Light Cone and Re:Voir
results.brief_description: Using Super-8 and an experimental technique of allowing bacterial decomposition and chemical breakdown of the film emulsion, a practice Jurgen Reble worked on as a former member of the German filmmaking group known as “Schmelzdahin” during the 1980s, “Rumpelstilzchen” and “Passion” feature as part of Reble’s first solo works in this unusual and surrealistic style of filmmaking. Familiar to both pieces is the often repetitive and pulsating rhythmic soundtrack and images using both micro and macro cinematography and themes of creation, evolution and destruction. An intriguing concept and interpretation into the chemistry of life.

results.title: Royal tour of Queen Elizabeth II
results.brief_description: In 1954, huge crowds greeted Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip on her Australian tour, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.

constellations_primary.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_primary.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

constellations_other.name: Spectacle
constellations_other.description: The moving image has captured some of history’s biggest moments. From newsreel shorts in cinemas before the show to the arrival of TV, nightly news and the 24-hour news cycle to social media, news has become a spectacle.

results.description: In 1954, Queen Elizabeth II was the first reigning monarch to visit Australia. Huge crowds greeted the Queen and Prince Philip, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage from the tour was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.
description_for_label: In 1954, Queen Elizabeth II was the first reigning monarch to visit Australia. Huge crowds greeted the Queen and Prince Philip, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage from the tour was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.

group.title: Cinesound Review and Fox Movietone News

results.title: 'Tank Man' protestor, Tiananmen Square
results.brief_description: ‘An unknown man stared down a column of tanks the morning after the Chinese government massacred pro-democracy demonstrators in Tiananmen Square in 1989. His fate and identity remain unknown, but the moment – captured on film and smuggled to safety – has become a symbol of defiance.

constellations_primary.name: Uncovering the truth
constellations_primary.description: The images of Tank Man during the Tiananmen Square protests in 1989 were captured by photojournalists and shared around the world. The work of journalists has been key to uncovering abuses of power and are rich material for fictional and factual movies and TV.

constellations_other.name: Spectacle
constellations_other.description: The moving image has captured some of history’s biggest moments. From newsreel shorts in cinemas before the show to the arrival of TV, nightly news and the 24-hour news cycle to social media, news has become a spectacle.
